#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Erzurum
#Text=Erzurum is a city in Eastern Anatolia , and is the hub for visiting eastern Turkey .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Erzurum is the highest major city ( population : 360,000 according to 2000 census ) in Turkey , situated at an altitude of about 2000 metres above sea level .

#Text=Combined with the distance to the sea , this makes the climate of this area the harshest in Turkey with the temperatures in long , heavily snowy , and bitterly cold winter regularly below -30°C at nights ( and no warmer than -15°C during the day ) .

#Text=Wet summers in Erzurum are around 30°C in the day time and chilly at night , although temperatures dropping down to freezing point during summer are becoming rarer and rarer each year , probably with the advance of global warming .
#Text=The city hosted the international 2011 Winter Universiade ( “ university olympic games ” ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=The Doğu Express runs daily from Ankara to Erzurum , departing at 18:00 and arriving 20 hours later around 14:00 .
#Text=This train continues to Kars , taking another 4 hours .
#Text=The return train leaves Kars around 08:00 and Erzurum around noon .
#Text=There are couchettes , a sleeping car ( maybe ) and a buffet .
#Text=The main stops along the route are Kayseri , Sivas , and Erzincan , for details see Turkish Railways website .
#Text=In summer 2019 a tourist train plies between Ankara and Kars , with a two hour stop in Erzurum for sightseeing .
#Text=You 're tied to the tourist itinerary without flexibility of stopover .
#Text=The accommodation is in standard sleeping cars : these have been provided by pulling sleeping cars off the conventional trains , so the travel experience on those has been degraded .
#Text=A high-speed railway line is under construction from Ankara towards Erzurum and Kars .
#Text=This will greatly reduce journey times when the first section to Sivas opens , perhaps in 2020 .
#Text=Erzurum railway station ( Erzurum Garı ) ( At the northern end of city centre ) .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Erzurum Airport ( ERZ ) ( 10 km from city center ) .
#Text=Daily flights from Istanbul ( by Onur Air , Turkish Airlines , and Pegasus ) and direct flights from Izmir , Ankara , and Antalya .
#Text=In winter , there are also flights from Russia and Ukraine .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Most bus services use Erzurum Otogar , which is about 10 km away from the city centre .
#Text=Take a local bus or taxi to the centre .

#Text=Buses from Trabzon in the north , on the Black Sea coast , take around 4½ and cost 30 TL ( but , if you do n't look too much like a tourist , it might be possible to bargain it down to 25 TL ) , while buses from Diyarbakır in the south take a little more than 6 hours and have the standard fare of 50 TL , which might be bargainable down to 35 TL .
#Text=Get around

#Text=Erzurum is a pretty small city , and you can cover most of it by foot , unless you are thinking of heading out and around the city , in which case , most public buses and taxis will be able to get you there .
#Text=See
#Text=Twin Minaret Madrasa ( Çifte Minareli Medrese ) .
#Text=Built as a theological school a few years before 1265 , it takes its name from the two fluted minarets that crown the monumental façade .
#Text=Citadel of Erzurum .
#Text=Situated on the top of the hill in the middle of the city centre .
#Text=The 3 TL admission fee allows you to explore the grounds as well as to climb up the minaret/clock tower , and visit the citadel masjid .
#Text=It 's worth the effort to climb up the clock tower as it gives you a commanding view of the city and the surrounding mountains .
#Text=Do
#Text=Palandöken Ski Center .
#Text=Only 10 minutes away from city centre by public bus .
#Text=In summer you can hike up to the top of Palandöken ( 3,150 m above sea level ) for fantastic views .
#Text=There is a road ( first paved up to some of the hotels , then a dirt road ) up to the very top , but it is possible to take shortcuts when hiking .
#Text=There are no marked trails , but the directions are clearly visible .
#Text=It is good to start early to allow time to enjoy the views .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Oltutaşı ( Oltu stone in Turkish ) — This is a kind of amber which is extracted only in Oltu , a town near Erzurum .
#Text=It is mostly chipped into jewelry , with different levels of quality and correspondingly different levels of prices .
#Text=Look around in Erzurum .
#Text=Taşhan is the best place to shop for Oltutaşı and it is also an interesting traditional building .
#Text=Silver — In jewelry shops in the center or on Taşmağazalar street , fancy authentic silver jewelry can be found .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Stockbreeding is widespread in the region , and there is little chance to cultivate vegetables and fruits in this high and cold land .
#Text=Therefore traditional food is mainly dependent on meat .
#Text=The city is also known for different types of local cheese that is hard to find elsewhere in Turkey .
#Text=Kadayıf dolması — A must-taste local dessert of Erzurum cuisine .
#Text=It is made from kadayıf , a sweet pastry that is lots of thin fibres of flour put together .
#Text=Walnuts are stuffed in the kadayıf and the stuffed kadayıf is first fried , then cooled and finally ready to serve with addition of a sweet sauce .
#Text=It may be sampled in virtually every restaurant in Erzurum , but some of the best can be tried in a specialist restaurant , Muammer Usta
#Text=Döner — Typical Turkish döner is really made well and should be tasted in [ http://www.donercihacibaba.com.tr/online-rezervasyon/ankara/ Hacı Baba Restaurant ( 10AM-10PM ) İsmetpaşa Cad .
#Text=33 .
#Text=Cağ kebap — local kebab of Erzurum , that you can have in Gelgor Restaurant .
#Text=It is made with lamb meat and the preparation is like döner , but unlike döner , instead of a vertical axis , the meat is cooked on a horizontal axis .
#Text=Güzelyurt Restaurant — A very nice old restaurant right in the city center on Cumhuriyet Caddesi .
#Text=You can have a good Turkish meal with some Turkish raki and enjoy the atmosphere .
#Text=Hmmburger — A very tiny small hamburger place .
#Text=Hamburgers are really delicious .
#Text=Coffeebox — A local coffeeshop , with various pasta options and nice coffees .
